org.epochx.core
Class GenerationManager

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.core.GenerationManager

public class GenerationManager
extends java.lang.Object

This component is responsible for carrying out single generations of an evolutionary run. A generation receives a population of CandidatePrograms, performs genetic operations (usually with some selection pressure) on those programs and returns a new population of CandidatePrograms.

An instance of GenerationManager is tied to a Model.

Use of a generation will generate the following events:

Event Revert Modify Raised when?
onConfigure no no Immediately before the onGenerationStart event.
onGenerationStart no no Before the generation is started.
onGeneration yes yes Immediately after the generation is completed, giving the listener the opportunity to request a revert which will cause the generation to be performed again starting from the previous population. This will result in this event being raised again.
onGenerationEnd no no After the generation has been completed.

Constructor Detail

GenerationManager

public GenerationManager(Model model)
Constructs a generation manager for carrying out generations. The given Model defines how the components will be configured for the generation.

Parameters:
model - a model which will provide the control parameters and operators for the generation.
Method Detail

generation

public java.util.List<CandidateProgram> generation(int generationNo,
                                                   java.util.List<CandidateProgram> previousPop)
Performs one generation of an evolutionary run. The method receives the previous population and then performs one generation and returns the resultant population.

A generation consists of the following sequence of events:

  1. Select the elites and put them into the next population.
  2. Select a breeding pool of programs.
  3. Randomly choose an operator based upon probablities from the model:
    • Crossover - pass control to crossover component.
    • Mutation - pass control to mutation component.
    • Reproduction - pass control to reproduction component.
  4. Insert the result of the operator into the next population.
  5. Start back at 3. until the next population is full.
  6. Return the new population.

The necessary events trigger life cycle events.

Parameters:
generationNo - the sequential number which identifies this generation out of all the generations of this run.
previousPop - the previous population which will undergo manipulation to create the next population.
Returns:
the population derived from performing genetic operations on the previous population.

getElitismManager

public ElitismManager getElitismManager()
Retrieves this generation manager's elitism manager that will perform the operation elitism.

Returns:
the elitism manager that is responsible for the task of elitism for each generation.

getPoolSelectionManager

public PoolSelectionManager getPoolSelectionManager()
Retrieves this generation manager's pool selection manager that will handle the task of constructing a breeding pool.

Returns:
the pool selection manager that is responsible for the task of constructing a breeding pool for each generation.

the crossover manager that is responsible for the managing the task of crossover for each generation.
